name: electricity production, natural gas, conventional power plant | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1697/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity in a natural gas, conventional power plant in Peru. This dataset is based on the dataset "electricity production, natural gas, at conventional power plant, GLO" (accessed October 2017) and adapted using regional data, such as efficiency and net electricity production.  The regional data was obtained from nine power plants  in the country in 2014, which are the following: Santa Rosa (28.6%), Malacas (15.7%), Pisco (19.0%), Aguaytia (13.7), Termochilca (13%), Las Flores (7.2%) and Tablazo (2.8%) . The approximate conventional natural gas power plants production  in Peru is 6.6 % of the total in the country. Data was obtained from the Committee of Economic Operations of the National Interconnected System (COES), the national peruvian entity that regulates the dispatch and generation of energy from the electricity sector. The COES publishes the statistics of operations of the National Interconnected System (SEIN) in an annual basis.  In addition, public access information was requested from the General Directorate of Environmental Energy Affairs (DGAAE) of the Ministry of Energy and Mines on Environmental Impact Studies (EIA) of the plants,  as well as, the Environmental Monitoring Reports (IMA) presented by the power plants quarterly,  the reports and studies were obtained for Las Flores, Aguaytia, Termochilca, Malacas and Santa Rosa.;For the peruvian natural gas conventional power plants, the  efficiency vary between 24 and 40 %. Gestión de la Información. COES, 2014) ;The efficiency calculations consider fuel input vs. electricity/heat produced. Even if efficiencies vary with different surrounding temperatures, temperature adjustments would be related to high uncertainties;EMISSIONS: Emissions of NOx, CO, CO2, SO2, particles, and CH4 were estimated using emission factors from EPA, 1998., as per the OSINERGMIN, supervisory body for energy and mining investment (http://www.osinergmin.gob.pe/seccion/centro_documental/Institucional/Estudios_Economicos/Libros/anexo-industria-hidrocarburos-liquidos-Peru.pdf retrieved 24 august 2017).                                                                                                                                                                      Based on the dataset of natural gas burned in a conventional power plant ("electricity production, natural gas, at conventional power plant, PE, 2008-2008", accessed October 2017") other exchanges were adjusted. ;-	Organic compound emissions are estimated on the basis of EPA 1998. ;Sources:;-	CORINAIR 2001. EMEP/CORINAIR 2001: Joint EMEP/CORINAIR Atmospheric Emission Inventory Guidebook, Third Edition. Copenhagen: European Environment Agency, 2001. http://reports.eea.eu.int/technical_report_2001_3/en.;-	EPA 1998. US Environmental Protection Agency (1998). Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, AP-42, Fifth Edition, Volume I: Chapter 1: External Combustion Sources, Natural Gas Combustion - Final Section - Supplement D , July 1998. CHIEF (Clearinghouse for Inventories and Emission Factors). Research Triangle Park, North Carolina. http://www.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/.;-	Rentz O., Karl U., Peter H. (2002). Ermittlung und Evaluierung von Emissionsfaktoren für Feuerungsanlagen in Deutschland für die Jahre 1995, 2000 und 2010. Deutsch- Französisches Institut für Umweltforschung, Uni Karsruhe. Endbericht. Im Auftrag des Umweltbundesamtes. Forschungsbericht 299 43 142. Umweltbundesamt. Berlin.;COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO N° 6.3 CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE EN LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS 2014,CUADRO N° 6.2 RENDIMIENTO PROMEDIO ANUAL - 2014.  November 14, 2017. ;MINEM, 2014. Ministerio de Energía y Minas (2014). Anuario Ejecutivo de Electricidad 2014. Dirección General de Electricidad. Retrieved online from http://www.minem.gob.pe/_estadisticaSector.php?idSector=6,  24 august 2017.            ;MINEM, 2017. Ministerio de Energía y Minas (20147).Preguntas Frecuentes en Relación al Gas Natural en el Perú http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf. Retrieved online 24 august 2017. ;OSINERGMIN, 2015. Oganismo Supervisor de la Energía y Mineria. La industria de los hidrocarburos líquidos en el Perú: 20 años de aporte al desarrollo del país (2015) http://www.osinergmin.gob.pe/seccion/centro_documental/Institucional/Estudios_Economicos/Libros/anexo-industria-hidrocarburos-liquidos-Peru.pdf. Retrieved online 24 august 2017.;EPA, 1998. US Environmental Protection Agency (1998). AP 42 -Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, Volume 1: Stationary Point and Area Sources Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, AP-42, AP 42, Fifth Edition.  Natural Gas Combustion ;Final Section - Supplement D , July 1998. https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/index.html. Retrieved online 24 august 2017.;The split of the natural gas power plants by technology was performed using the data reported by (COES, 2014).;Technology “Turbina a Gas” = Natural gas, conventional;Technology “CC TG-TV”  = Natural gas, combined cycle;;Source: Estadisticas Anuales 2014 02_Estadistica 02_EXCEL 06_PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE DEL SEIN, CUADRO N° 6.8 _COSTOS VARIABLES DE LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS DEL COES.xlsx  URL: http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ accessed on November 14, 2017.

From the constructed natural gas power plant ready to produce electricity. 

From reception of natural gas and operating materials at power plant/factory gate

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes:
 - all operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants.
 - Cooling: It is a assumed that all plants use wet cooling with a cooling tower.No cooling tower is included in this dataset (will be implemented in future versions)
 - decarbonised water use for reduction of NOx emissions 

This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets.
 - transformation of the electricity produced.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: In Peru, the Economic Operation Committee of the National Interconnected System (COES) is divided in three operation areas, north, central and south. The nine power plants considered in this dataset are located as follows: in the north operation area,  Malacas  and Tablazo; in the central area, Aguaytia, Santa Rosa, Las Flores, Pisco, Independencia, Termochilca and Oquendo.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Conventional natural gas power plant of 100MWe. The plant is used for middle load with 5000 hours of operation at full capacity per year. The plant is assumed to operate 180000 hours during its lifetime.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
This dataset is based on GLO dataset, "electricity production, natural gas, at conventional power plant, GLO" (accessed October 2017). Data from nine Peruvian power plants that account for 100% of the natural gas conventional electricity production were considered, including net electricity production and efficiency (COES, 2014).
The PM<2.5 emission, cooling and feed water exchanges were taken from the PE dataset: "electricity production, natural gas, at conventional power plant, PE, 2008-2008", accessed October 2017.

For the following exchanges, emission factors from EPA were used:
*exchange amount_PM<2.5
*exchange amount_carbon dioxide, fossil (kg CO2/kWh)
*exchange amount_carbon monoxide fossil
*exchange amount_methane fossil (kg CH4/kWh)
*exchange amount_nitrogen oxide (kg NOx/kWh)
*exchange amount_PM>2.5<10
*exchange amount_sulfur dioxide (kg SO2/kWh)

Source:
EPA AP 42, Fifth Edition, Volume I Chapter 1: External Combustion, 1.4 NATURAL GAS COMBUSTION. Retrieved online from URL: <https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/final/c01s04.pdf>  accessed on 24 august 2017.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Peruvian national statistics and environmental reports from nine plants.

flow.name: electricity, high voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description:
Calculated emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity by burning natural gas in a conventional cycle power plant. Weighted average based on the fuel consumption and net electricity production of the following natural gas conventional cycle power plants in Peru (COES, 2014) and emission factor from (EPA, 1998).


Power plant		Net electricity production (GWh)	Natural gas (ft3 10E+3)    
TG Santa Rosa WTG - Gas	3.22E+00			3.68E+04		
Sta Rosa TG8		7.90E+02			7.83E+06		
Malacas TG1		5.20E+00			1.29E+05		
Malacas TG4		4.32E+02			5.23E+06		
Pisco TG1		2.84E+02			3.28E+06		
Pisco TG2		2.43E+02			2.83E+06		
Las Flores		8.05E+01			8.17E+05		
Las Flores		1.22E+02			1.24E+06		
Tablazo			8.00E+01			8.65E+05		
TG1 Aguaytía		2.72E+02			3.82E+06		
TG2 Aguaytía		1.08E+02			1.47E+06		
Termochilca TG1		3.56E+02			3.53E+06
		
Source for electricity production and fuel consumption:
COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO N° 6.3 CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE EN LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS 2014,CUADRO N° 6.2 RENDIMIENTO PROMEDIO ANUAL - 2014.  accessed on November 14, 2017. 

Source for allocation in combined cycle and conventional cycle technology:
COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO, No 6.8_COSTOS VARIABLES DE LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS DEL COES.  accessed on November 14, 2017.

Substance 			Emission factor lb/(scf 10E+6)
Óxidos de nitrógeno (NOx)		140
Monoxido de carbono (CO)		84

Dióxido de azufre (SO2)		0.6
Metano (CH4)			2.3

Source:
EPA AP 42, Fifth Edition, Volume I Chapter 1: External Combustion, 1.4 NATURAL GAS COMBUSTION. Retrieved online from URL: <https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/final/c01s04.pdf>  accessed on 24 august 2017.

flow.name: Carbon monoxide, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the burning of 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 11 countries 
(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007) 
Country emissions values estimate from range of values from different references. See Tab. 11.19, p. 138 in Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the burning of 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 11 countries

Country emissions values estimate from range of values from different references. See Tab. 11.19, p. 138 in Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Acenaphthene
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Calculated emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity by burning natural gas in a conventional cycle power plant. Weighted average based on the fuel consumption and net electricity production of the following natural gas conventional cycle power plants in Peru (COES, 2014) and emission factor from (EPA, 1998).


Power plant		Net electricity production (GWh)	Natural gas (ft3 10E+3)    
TG Santa Rosa WTG - Gas	3.22E+00			3.68E+04		
Sta Rosa TG8		7.90E+02			7.83E+06		
Malacas TG1		5.20E+00			1.29E+05		
Malacas TG4		4.32E+02			5.23E+06		
Pisco TG1		2.84E+02			3.28E+06		
Pisco TG2		2.43E+02			2.83E+06		
Las Flores		8.05E+01			8.17E+05		
Las Flores		1.22E+02			1.24E+06		
Tablazo			8.00E+01			8.65E+05		
TG1 Aguaytía		2.72E+02			3.82E+06		
TG2 Aguaytía		1.08E+02			1.47E+06		
Termochilca TG1		3.56E+02			3.53E+06
		
Source for electricity production and fuel consumption:
COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO N° 6.3 CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE EN LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS 2014,CUADRO N° 6.2 RENDIMIENTO PROMEDIO ANUAL - 2014.  accessed on November 14, 2017. 

Source for allocation in combined cycle and conventional cycle technology:
COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO, No 6.8_COSTOS VARIABLES DE LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS DEL COES.  accessed on November 14, 2017. 

Low heating value of natural gas 9030 kcal/m3	 
Source: http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf accessed on November 14, 2017.

Density of natural gas: 0.65 kg/m3	
Source: http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf accessed on November 14, 2017.


Substance 			Emission factor lb/(scf 10E+6)
Óxidos de nitrógeno (NOx)		140
Monoxido de carbono (CO)		84
Dióxido de carbono (CO2)		120000
Óxido nitroso (N2O) controlado	0.64
Dióxido de azufre (SO2)		0.6
Metano (CH4)			2.3

Source:
EPA AP 42, Fifth Edition, Volume I Chapter 1: External Combustion, 1.4 NATURAL GAS COMBUSTION. Retrieved online from URL: <https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/final/c01s04.pdf>  accessed on 24 august 2017.
